Hannibal: Rom gegen Carthago
Hannibal: Rome contre Carthage
Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage
Ганнибал. Рим против Карфагена.
汉尼拔:罗马对迦太基
漢尼拔:羅馬對迦太基
boardgame.description: This game uses the very popular card system which first appeared in Avalon Hill's We the People game to detail the struggle between Carthage's Hannibal and the Roman Republic in approximately 200 BC._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage is an asymmetrical card driven game for 2 players set in times of epic struggle between ancient Rome and Carthage. It presents a conflict between two super-powers of Antiquity from classical Clausewitzian perspective, according to which a power only reverts to military operations when there is no other way to achieve the goal: political dominance._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage has been designed by one of the most acclaimed designers in the World, Mark Simonitch. Players use Strategy Cards for multiple purposes: moving generals, levying new troops, reinforcing existing armies, gaining political control of the provinces involved in the war, and introducing historical events. When two armies meet on the battlefield, a second set of cards, called Battle Cards, are used to determine the winner. Ultimately both players seek victory by dominating both fronts: military and political._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;The 20th Anniversary of the release of this classic game will see the release of a new, revised, updated, and expanded game entitled Hannibal _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Hamilcar. This new edition reimplements the Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage game, and includes the Hamilcar: First Punic War expansion. See the Hannibal _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp; Hamilcar entry for details of the 2017 revamped game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Has some pen marking on the board charts were errata was corrected by hand. Yes it is complete. I recounted all the components today. Please note that the rulebook claims that there are 132 political and 100 combat units. This has never been the case as the game never came with 100 combat units. I compared the actual pieces to these scans here: http://www.thewargamer.com/Scans/HannibalCombat_AH.jpg http://www.thewargamer.com/Scans/HannibalMarkers_AH.jpg My game does include all 48 Battle Cards and 64 Strategy Cards. It includes the following counters: 101 PC 13 cities 8 consul 1 proconsul 1 turn marker 8 tribes = 132 political markers and 14 leaders 28 Romans 19 Carthage 5 siege 1 siege train 2 elephants combat units, which you will see is the proper mix from the scanned sheet.

Valley Games (VLY 401) One of the greatest military commanders and tacticians in history descends on the Roman Empire once again. Do you face him as Rome and try to ward the invasion that comes from the North, or do you climb atop your war elephant and show Rome you will take that which they hold most dear: their territory. Designed with all new artwork from Kurt Miller this is a reprint of the very popular Avalon-Hill version from 1996. The game uses the popular card system, which first appeared in Avalon Hill_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s We the People, to recount the Second Punic War from 218 to 203 B.C. Players use strategic-level cards for multiple purposes: moving generals, levying new troops, reinforcing existing armies, gaining political control of the provinces involved in the war, and generating historical events. When two armies meet on the battlefield, a second set of cards, called Battle Cards, are used to determine the winner. Ultimately both players seek victory by dominating both fronts: military and political. This is a 2-player game with a playing time of approximately 150 minutes.

Valley Games (VLY 401) One of the greatest military commanders and tacticians in history descends on the Roman Empire once again. Do you face him as Rome and try to ward the invasion that comes from the North, or do you climb atop your war elephant and show Rome you will take that which they hold most dear: their territory. Designed with all new artwork from Kurt Miller this is a reprint of the very popular Avalon-Hill version from 1996. The game uses the popular card system, which first appeared in Avalon Hill_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s We the People, to recount the Second Punic War from 218 to 203 B.C. Players use strategic-level cards for multiple purposes: moving generals, levying new troops, reinforcing existing armies, gaining political control of the provinces involved in the war, and generating historical events. When two armies meet on the battlefield, a second set of cards, called Battle Cards, are used to determine the winner. Ultimately both players seek victory by dominating both fronts: military and political. This is a 2-player game with a playing time of approximately 150 minutes.

Description: Hannibal_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s daring assault on the Roman Republic is re-fought by you in Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage. Designed with all new artwork from Kurt Miller, this is a reprint of the very popular Avalon Hill version of 1996. Hannibal: Rome vs. Carthage uses a popular card system, which first appeared in Avalon Hill’s We the People, to recount the Second Punic War from 218 to 203 B.C. Hannibal has been called the _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;father of strategy_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; and players will use strategic-level cards for multiple purposes in this game: moving generals, levying new troops, reinforcing existing armies, gaining political control of the provinces engaged in the war and generating historical events. When two armies meet on the battlefield, a second set of cards, called Battle Cards, are used to determine the winner. Ultimately both players seek victory by dominating both fronts: military and political. This is a 2-player game with a playing time of approximately 150 minutes. ************************************* Our Philosophy: We are not satisfied unless you are satisfied! It_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s that simple. In business for over 5 years, we understand the most critical aspects of ecommerce. You will receive a price quote for each shipping option and you choose which of these two shipping option best fits your needs. All shipments are made within 2-3 days of receiving your cleared PayPal payment. Note: feel free to combine items to reduce shipping cost. Returns: Our return policy mirrors our philosophy; we are not satisfied unless you are satisfied!
